net.adamcin.commons.jcr.batch

Interface BatchSession

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Session
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultBatchSession

    public interface BatchSession
extends Session
    Simple interface extension defining additional methods useful to managing batch JCR operations

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface javax.jcr.Session

        ACTION_ADD_NODE, ACTION_READ, ACTION_REMOVE, ACTION_SET_PROPERTY

    • Method Detail

      • getSession

        Session getSession()
        Returns:
        the underlying JCR session

      • addListener

        void addListener(BatchSessionListener listener)
        Add a BatchSessionListener to the session, to receive notifications when the session auto-saves
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be added

      • removeListener

        void removeListener(BatchSessionListener listener)
        Removes a BatchSessionListener from the session.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be removed.

      • setBatchSize

        void setBatchSize(int batchSize)
        The batch size determines when the BatchSession will auto-save. When a change is made using this session proxy, it will check to see if the number of paths with uncommitted changes matches or exceeds the batch size to determine if an auto-save is necessary. The default batch size is 1024 nodes.
        Parameters:
        batchSize -

      • getBatchSize

        int getBatchSize()
        Returns:
        the currently configured batch size

      • getTotalSaves

        int getTotalSaves()
        Returns:
        the number of saves committed by this session since instantiation

      • getCommittedPaths

        Set<String> getCommittedPaths()
        Returns:
        set of all paths with changes committed by this BatchSession

      • getUncommittedPaths

        Set<String> getUncommittedPaths()
        Returns:
        the set of paths that have uncommitted changes according to this BatchSession

      • disableSessionSave

        boolean disableSessionSave()
        Ignore calls to session saves. Useful for suppressing save calls in API's that are agnostic to this interface. Call enableSessionSave() to re-enable Session.save()
        Returns:
        true if this call changed the state from enabled to disabled

      • enableSessionSave

        boolean enableSessionSave()
        Re-enable calls to session saves after a call to disableSessionSave()
        Returns:
        true if this call changed the state from disabled to enabled

      • isSessionSaveEnabled

        boolean isSessionSaveEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if calls to Session.save() will actually do anything

      • disableAutoSave

        boolean disableAutoSave()
        Disables autoSave even when the batchSize is exceeded. Call enableAutoSave() to re-enable autoSaves.
        Returns:
        true if this call changed the state from enabled to disabled

      • enableAutoSave

        boolean enableAutoSave()
        Re-enables autoSave for future changes after a call to disableAutoSave().
        Returns:
        true if this call changed the state from disabled to enabled

      • isAutoSaveEnabled

        boolean isAutoSaveEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if auto-save logic will kick in after the configured batch size is reached.

      • commit

        void commit()
            throws RepositoryException
        Immediately re-enables session saves and autoSaves, and then saves any uncommitted changes. Should be called by client code after all changes have been processed for the given JCR session.
        Throws:
        RepositoryException

      • purge

        void purge(String path)
           throws RepositoryException
        Recursively removes the subgraph of Nodes and related Version Nodes, descending from path, by traversing depth-first to the leaves and removing each node on the way up. Versions are marked for removal, but are only removed after a session save because version modifications are workspace-write operations, not session-write operations.
        Parameters:
        path - the node at the top of the subgraph
        Throws:
        RepositoryException - if anything goes wrong
